In May, the experience of the ten navigators who crossed between the meridians of 1050 and 127 0 would, at first sight, seem to indicate that between 1150 and 1200 is the best crossing for this mouth. But when we come to consider the sailing qualities of the vessels concerned, we find reason to believe that the difficulties of the passage do not depend upon where you cross the Line in May, provided you do not cross to the East of 1000 ·,
